class vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.x86.AsmRegEx_x86.AsmRegEx_x86[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.x86_64.AsmRegEx_x86_64.AsmRegEx_x86_64

Contains regular expressions (mostly in verbose mode) used for analyzing the assembler file on the x86 architecture.

Parameters:

RE_CLASSREF :

match e.g. “[ds:cls_NSAssertionHandler]” or “dword [ds:eax-0x25e1+cls_Object1]”

RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT :

match e.g. “dword [ds:ecx+0x8]”

Methods

compiled_re(regex[, flags]) Returns a compiled regex pattern object Flags will only be passed if not None.
compiled_re_stack(stack_pointer_name) Return a compiled regular expression that matches e.g.
compiled_vre(regex[, flags]) Returns a compiled regex pattern object
is_entrypoint(asmline) Check if line is entry point in asm file (See AsmRegEx.RE_MATCH_ENTRYPOINT)
is_method_implementation(asmline) Indicates if a line is a CategoryClass or method implementation.
method_implementation_is_static(...) Returns if the method is static
RE_CLASSREF = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n ([-\\w]+[+])* # eax-0x25e1+\n cls[_] # cls_\n (?P<classref>\\w+) # Object1\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_CLASSREF_GR_CLASSREF = 'classref'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n (?P<class>\\w+) # ecx\n \\+ # +\n (?P<var>0x\\w+) # 0x8\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT_GR_IVAR_ADDR = 'var'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT_GR_SELF_REGISTER = 'class'¶

create_and_store_method_selector_arguments(method_selector)[source]¶

Create and store the arguments for the method_selector. There will be as many arguments created as the Selector needs and stored as StackVar.

Parameters:

method_selector: Selector :

the Selector describing the method that is currently being read by the Cpu
Raises:

SelectorOverloadedException :

if selector has more arguments than it needs

parse_objc_class_from_classref(asmline)[source]¶

Create ObjcClass from classref ([ds:cls_NSAssertionHandler])

parse_var_assignment_with_ivar_ref_from_asmline(asmline)[source]¶

Create a VarAssignment from asmline like e.g. “mov dword [ds:ecx+0x8], eax”. Try to resolve the ivar_ref of the IVar from the register of the right side of the assignment.

The difference to x86_64 is that the ivar_dest of the VarAssignment is no register and cannot be resolved.

Parameters:

asmline: String :

the asmline should have the form of “[ds:rdx+rsi], rax” where the part after the comma is optional. If left out, the ivar_ref cannot be resolved.

cpu: Cpu :

the cpu which is needed for resolving the values of the registers
Returns:

VarAssignment :

the VarAssignment with ivar_ref set (None if no VarAssignment)
Raises:

VarAssignmentResolveSelfrefRegisterException :
parse_var_assignment_without_ivar_ref_from_asmline(asmline)[source]¶

Create a VarAssignment from asmline like e.g. “mov dword [ds:ecx+0x8]”.

The difference to x86_64 is that the ivar_dest of the VarAssignment is no register and cannot be resolved.

Parameters:

asmline: String :
Returns:

VarAssignment :

the VarAssignment without ivar_ref set (None if no VarAssignment)
Raises:

VarAssignmentResolveSelfrefRegisterException :

Bases: vizasm.model.asm.Register.Register

Implements an register for the x86 architecture
